title: Ticket #2700: Centralize tool functionality into a tool core
description:
Several tools share initialization steps and have duplicate code across all of them as a result. Creating a single location for this code will reduce duplication and also help reduce tedious changes when the functions called by all the tools end up changing.

  • V7_7-tool_core-branch

Steps:

  • Unify debug, version, help, address, and pool options. The debug option at least needs to be unified before attempting to do further work on the dprintf code, as changing dprintf_config currently entails changing over a dozen callsites all doing the same thing.
  • Identify what else is shared amongst tools.
remarks:
2011-Dec-20 14:38:22 by ziliang:
Common/Semi-common options
  • -address
  • -debug
  • -help
  • -name: complication, name is sometimes daemon name, sometimes hostname
  • -pool: central manager hostname
  • -version

Tools

  • advertise: does not have -address or -name options
  • config_val: no -version, -debug is not mentioned in the usage but exists, -name refers to daemon name, even though we have -master, -startd, -schedd, etc
  • cod_tool: -name is startd hostname
  • fetch_log: no -addr
  • wait: no -addr, no -pool, no -name
  • check_user_log: not needed
  • history: only has -help and -debug, -debug is not mentioned in usage
  • transfer_data: -name means schedd name, -debug documentation is commented out
  • store_cred: no -version, -d instead of -debug, -h instead of -help, -n instead of -name for specific machine hostname, no -addr, no -pool
  • submit: -name is schedd name, -addr is schedd address, no -version, -debug present but not documented
  • status: -version not documented, no -addr, condor_status is considerably more complex and seems to have order dependencies for arguments
  • rm: -debug present but documentation commented out, -name is schedd name
  • qedit: has dependency on specific ordering of arguments, might not be able to merge its argument handling
  • q: has -addr, not documented, -debug is documented in usage, but does not warn user that we also need a debug flag, -name is schedd name
  • preen: only has -debug
  • test_auth: instead of name, has daemontype to get daemon name, otherwise only has -debug

2012-Jan-16 13:31:04 by ziliang:
Lessons learned: match_prefix is a lie. Created match_prefix_real to compensate due to concerns about existing usages of match_prefix in places besides argument parsing.
